natural problem: Real numbers $r$ and $s$ are roots of $p(x)=x^3+ax+b$, and $r+4$ and $s-3$ are roots of $q(x)=x^3+ax+b+240$. Enter all possible values of $b,$ separated by commas.
natural solution: By Vieta's formulas, the sum of the roots of $p(x)$ is 0, so the third root is $t = -r - s.$  Also, \[a = rs + rt + st.\]The sum of the roots of $q(x)$ is also 0, so the third root is $-(r + 4) - (s - 3) = -r - s - 1 = t - 1.$  Also, \[a = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[rs + rt + st = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]This simplifies to $t = 4r - 3s + 13.$

Also, $b = -rst$ and \[b + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[-rst + 240 = (r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Substituting $t = 4r - 3s + 13,$ we get \[-rs(4r - 3s + 13) + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(4r - 3s + 12).\]This simplifies to

\[r^2 - 2rs + s^2 + 7r - 7s - 8 = 0.\]Then $(r - s)^2 + 7(r - s) - 8 = 0,$ which factors as \[(r - s - 1)(r - s + 8) = 0.\]Thus, $r - s = 1$ or $r - s = -8.$ If $r - s = 1,$ then $s = r - 1,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r + 16.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r - 1) + (r + 16) = 0,$ which leads to $r = -5.$  Then $s = -6$ and $t = 11,$ and $b = -rst = -330.$
If $r - s = -8,$ then $s = r + 8,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r - 11.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r + 8) + (r - 11) = 0,$ which leads to $r = 1.$  Then $s = 9$ and $t = -10,$ and $b = -rst = 90.$
Thus, the possible values of $b$ are $\boxed{-330,90}.$

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b r s :: real and p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. p x = x powr 3 + a * x + b"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. q x = x powr 3 + a * x + b + 240"
and h2 : "poly p r = 0"
and h3 : "poly p s = 0"
and h4 : "poly q (r + 4) = 0"
and h5 : "poly q (s - 3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Real numbers $r$ and $s$ are roots of $p(x)=x^3+ax+b$, and $r+4$ and $s-3$ are roots of $q(x)=x^3+ax+b+240$. Enter all possible values of $b,$ separated by commas. The final Answer is -330,90
 ### Proof
 By Vieta's formulas, the sum of the roots of $p(x)$ is 0, so the third root is $t = -r - s.$  Also, \[a = rs + rt + st.\]The sum of the roots of $q(x)$ is also 0, so the third root is $-(r + 4) - (s - 3) = -r - s - 1 = t - 1.$  Also, \[a = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[rs + rt + st = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]This simplifies to $t = 4r - 3s + 13.$
 Also, $b = -rst$ and \[b + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[-rst + 240 = (r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Substituting $t = 4r - 3s + 13,$ we get \[-rs(4r - 3s + 13) + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(4r - 3s + 12).\]This simplifies to
 \[r^2 - 2rs + s^2 + 7r - 7s - 8 = 0.\]Then $(r - s)^2 + 7(r - s) - 8 = 0,$ which factors as \[(r - s - 1)(r - s + 8) = 0.\]Thus, $r - s = 1$ or $r - s = -8.$ If $r - s = 1,$ then $s = r - 1,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r + 16.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r - 1) + (r + 16) = 0,$ which leads to $r = -5.$  Then $s = -6$ and $t = 11,$ and $b = -rst = -330.$
 If $r - s = -8,$ then $s = r + 8,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r - 11.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r + 8) + (r - 11) = 0,$ which leads to $r = 1.$  Then $s = 9$ and $t = -10,$ and $b = -rst = 90.$
 Thus, the possible values of $b$ are $\boxed{-330,90}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a b r s :: real and p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. p x = x powr 3 + a * x + b"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. q x = x powr 3 + a * x + b + 240"
and h2 : "poly p r = 0"
and h3 : "poly p s = 0"
and h4 : "poly q (r + 4) = 0"
and h5 : "poly q (s - 3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Consider two cubic polynomials $p(x) = x^3 + ax + b$ and $q(x) = x^3 + ax + b + 240$. Suppose that $p(r) = 0$ and $p(s) = 0$. Furthermore, $q(r+4) = 0$ and $q(s-3) = 0$. What could be the possible values of $b$? The final answer is $b = -330$ or $b = 90$.

a_1.formal problem:
theorem
fixes p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
and a b r s :: real
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. p x = x^3 + a*x + b"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. q x = x^3 + a*x + b + 240"
and h2 : "p r = 0 \<and> p s = 0"
and h3 : "q (r+4) = 0 \<and> q (s-3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
a_1.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Real numbers $r$ and $s$ are roots of $p(x)=x^3+ax+b$, and $r+4$ and $s-3$ are roots of $q(x)=x^3+ax+b+240$. Enter all possible values of $b,$ separated by commas. The final Answer is -330,90
 ### Proof
 By Vieta's formulas, the sum of the roots of $p(x)$ is 0, so the third root is $t = -r - s.$  Also, \[a = rs + rt + st.\]The sum of the roots of $q(x)$ is also 0, so the third root is $-(r + 4) - (s - 3) = -r - s - 1 = t - 1.$  Also, \[a = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[rs + rt + st = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]This simplifies to $t = 4r - 3s + 13.$
 Also, $b = -rst$ and \[b + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[-rst + 240 = (r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Substituting $t = 4r - 3s + 13,$ we get \[-rs(4r - 3s + 13) + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(4r - 3s + 12).\]This simplifies to
 \[r^2 - 2rs + s^2 + 7r - 7s - 8 = 0.\]Then $(r - s)^2 + 7(r - s) - 8 = 0,$ which factors as \[(r - s - 1)(r - s + 8) = 0.\]Thus, $r - s = 1$ or $r - s = -8.$ If $r - s = 1,$ then $s = r - 1,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r + 16.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r - 1) + (r + 16) = 0,$ which leads to $r = -5.$  Then $s = -6$ and $t = 11,$ and $b = -rst = -330.$
 If $r - s = -8,$ then $s = r + 8,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r - 11.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r + 8) + (r - 11) = 0,$ which leads to $r = 1.$  Then $s = 9$ and $t = -10,$ and $b = -rst = 90.$
 Thus, the possible values of $b$ are $\boxed{-330,90}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
and a b r s :: real
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. p x = x^3 + a*x + b"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. q x = x^3 + a*x + b + 240"
and h2 : "p r = 0 \<and> p s = 0"
and h3 : "q (r+4) = 0 \<and> q (s-3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_1.informal problem: Given two cubic functions $p(x) = x^3 + ax + b$ and $q(x) = x^3 + ax + b + 240$, with $p(r) = p(s) = 0$ and $q(r+4) = q(s-3) = 0$, find the possible values of $b$. The final answers are $b = -330$ or $b = 90$.

a_2.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b r s :: real and p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. p x = x powr 3 + a * x + b"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. q x = x powr 3 + a * x + b + 240"
and h2 : "\<exists> r s. p r = 0 \<and> p s = 0"
and h3 : "\<exists> r s. q (r + 4) = 0 \<and> q (s - 3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
a_2.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Real numbers $r$ and $s$ are roots of $p(x)=x^3+ax+b$, and $r+4$ and $s-3$ are roots of $q(x)=x^3+ax+b+240$. Enter all possible values of $b,$ separated by commas. The final Answer is -330,90
 ### Proof
 By Vieta's formulas, the sum of the roots of $p(x)$ is 0, so the third root is $t = -r - s.$  Also, \[a = rs + rt + st.\]The sum of the roots of $q(x)$ is also 0, so the third root is $-(r + 4) - (s - 3) = -r - s - 1 = t - 1.$  Also, \[a = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[rs + rt + st = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]This simplifies to $t = 4r - 3s + 13.$
 Also, $b = -rst$ and \[b + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[-rst + 240 = (r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Substituting $t = 4r - 3s + 13,$ we get \[-rs(4r - 3s + 13) + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(4r - 3s + 12).\]This simplifies to
 \[r^2 - 2rs + s^2 + 7r - 7s - 8 = 0.\]Then $(r - s)^2 + 7(r - s) - 8 = 0,$ which factors as \[(r - s - 1)(r - s + 8) = 0.\]Thus, $r - s = 1$ or $r - s = -8.$ If $r - s = 1,$ then $s = r - 1,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r + 16.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r - 1) + (r + 16) = 0,$ which leads to $r = -5.$  Then $s = -6$ and $t = 11,$ and $b = -rst = -330.$
 If $r - s = -8,$ then $s = r + 8,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r - 11.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r + 8) + (r - 11) = 0,$ which leads to $r = 1.$  Then $s = 9$ and $t = -10,$ and $b = -rst = 90.$
 Thus, the possible values of $b$ are $\boxed{-330,90}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a b r s :: real and p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. p x = x powr 3 + a * x + b"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. q x = x powr 3 + a * x + b + 240"
and h2 : "\<exists> r s. p r = 0 \<and> p s = 0"
and h3 : "\<exists> r s. q (r + 4) = 0 \<and> q (s - 3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_2.informal problem: Consider two polynomial functions $p(x)$ and $q(x)$, defined by $p(x) = x^3 + ax + b$ and $q(x) = x^3 + ax + b + 240$. If there exist real numbers $r$ and $s$ such that $p(r) = 0$ and $p(s) = 0$, and also there exist real numbers $r$ and $s$ such that $q(r+4) = 0$ and $q(s-3) = 0$, then find the possible values of $b$. The final answer is $b = -330$ or $b = 90$.

a_3.formal problem:
theorem
fixes r s a b :: real and p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. p x = x powr 3 + a * x + b"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. q x = x powr 3 + a * x + b + 240"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. p x = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x = r \<or> x = s"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. q x = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x = r + 4 \<or> x = s - 3"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
a_3.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Real numbers $r$ and $s$ are roots of $p(x)=x^3+ax+b$, and $r+4$ and $s-3$ are roots of $q(x)=x^3+ax+b+240$. Enter all possible values of $b,$ separated by commas. The final Answer is -330,90
 ### Proof
 By Vieta's formulas, the sum of the roots of $p(x)$ is 0, so the third root is $t = -r - s.$  Also, \[a = rs + rt + st.\]The sum of the roots of $q(x)$ is also 0, so the third root is $-(r + 4) - (s - 3) = -r - s - 1 = t - 1.$  Also, \[a = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[rs + rt + st = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]This simplifies to $t = 4r - 3s + 13.$
 Also, $b = -rst$ and \[b + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[-rst + 240 = (r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Substituting $t = 4r - 3s + 13,$ we get \[-rs(4r - 3s + 13) + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(4r - 3s + 12).\]This simplifies to
 \[r^2 - 2rs + s^2 + 7r - 7s - 8 = 0.\]Then $(r - s)^2 + 7(r - s) - 8 = 0,$ which factors as \[(r - s - 1)(r - s + 8) = 0.\]Thus, $r - s = 1$ or $r - s = -8.$ If $r - s = 1,$ then $s = r - 1,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r + 16.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r - 1) + (r + 16) = 0,$ which leads to $r = -5.$  Then $s = -6$ and $t = 11,$ and $b = -rst = -330.$
 If $r - s = -8,$ then $s = r + 8,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r - 11.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r + 8) + (r - 11) = 0,$ which leads to $r = 1.$  Then $s = 9$ and $t = -10,$ and $b = -rst = 90.$
 Thus, the possible values of $b$ are $\boxed{-330,90}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes r s a b :: real and p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. p x = x powr 3 + a * x + b"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. q x = x powr 3 + a * x + b + 240"
and h2 : "\<forall> x. p x = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x = r \<or> x = s"
and h3 : "\<forall> x. q x = 0 \<longleftrightarrow> x = r + 4 \<or> x = s - 3"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_3.informal problem: Consider two cubic functions, $p(x) = x^3 + ax + b$ and $q(x) = x^3 + ax + b + 240.$ The function $p(x)$ has roots at $r$ and $s$, while the function $q(x)$ has roots at $r+4$ and $s-3$. Determine the possible values of $b$. The final answer is $b = -330$ or $b = 90$.

a_4.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b r s :: real
assumes h0 : "poly [b, a, 1] r = 0"
and h1 : "poly [b, a, 1] s = 0"
and h2 : "poly [b + 240, a, 1] (r + 4) = 0"
and h3 : "poly [b + 240, a, 1] (s - 3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
a_4.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Real numbers $r$ and $s$ are roots of $p(x)=x^3+ax+b$, and $r+4$ and $s-3$ are roots of $q(x)=x^3+ax+b+240$. Enter all possible values of $b,$ separated by commas. The final Answer is -330,90
 ### Proof
 By Vieta's formulas, the sum of the roots of $p(x)$ is 0, so the third root is $t = -r - s.$  Also, \[a = rs + rt + st.\]The sum of the roots of $q(x)$ is also 0, so the third root is $-(r + 4) - (s - 3) = -r - s - 1 = t - 1.$  Also, \[a = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[rs + rt + st = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]This simplifies to $t = 4r - 3s + 13.$
 Also, $b = -rst$ and \[b + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[-rst + 240 = (r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Substituting $t = 4r - 3s + 13,$ we get \[-rs(4r - 3s + 13) + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(4r - 3s + 12).\]This simplifies to
 \[r^2 - 2rs + s^2 + 7r - 7s - 8 = 0.\]Then $(r - s)^2 + 7(r - s) - 8 = 0,$ which factors as \[(r - s - 1)(r - s + 8) = 0.\]Thus, $r - s = 1$ or $r - s = -8.$ If $r - s = 1,$ then $s = r - 1,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r + 16.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r - 1) + (r + 16) = 0,$ which leads to $r = -5.$  Then $s = -6$ and $t = 11,$ and $b = -rst = -330.$
 If $r - s = -8,$ then $s = r + 8,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r - 11.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r + 8) + (r - 11) = 0,$ which leads to $r = 1.$  Then $s = 9$ and $t = -10,$ and $b = -rst = 90.$
 Thus, the possible values of $b$ are $\boxed{-330,90}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes a b r s :: real
assumes h0 : "poly [b, a, 1] r = 0"
and h1 : "poly [b, a, 1] s = 0"
and h2 : "poly [b + 240, a, 1] (r + 4) = 0"
and h3 : "poly [b + 240, a, 1] (s - 3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_4.informal problem: The roots of the quadratic equation $x^2 + ax + b = 0$ are $r$ and $s$. It's also given that $r + 4$ and $s - 3$ are the roots of the quadratic equation $x^2 + ax + (b + 240) = 0$. Find the value of $b$ that makes this possible. The possible values of $b$ are $-330$ or $90$.

a_5.formal problem:
definition p :: "real ⇒ real" where
"p x ≡ x^3 + a*x + b"

definition q :: "real ⇒ real" where
"q x ≡ x^3 + a*x + b + 240"

theorem roots:
fixes r s a b :: real
assumes h0 : "p r = 0"
and h1 : "p s = 0"
and h2 : "q (r+4) = 0"
and h3 : "q (s-3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 ∨ b = 90"

end
a_5.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Real numbers $r$ and $s$ are roots of $p(x)=x^3+ax+b$, and $r+4$ and $s-3$ are roots of $q(x)=x^3+ax+b+240$. Enter all possible values of $b,$ separated by commas. The final Answer is -330,90
 ### Proof
 By Vieta's formulas, the sum of the roots of $p(x)$ is 0, so the third root is $t = -r - s.$  Also, \[a = rs + rt + st.\]The sum of the roots of $q(x)$ is also 0, so the third root is $-(r + 4) - (s - 3) = -r - s - 1 = t - 1.$  Also, \[a = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[rs + rt + st = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]This simplifies to $t = 4r - 3s + 13.$
 Also, $b = -rst$ and \[b + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[-rst + 240 = (r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Substituting $t = 4r - 3s + 13,$ we get \[-rs(4r - 3s + 13) + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(4r - 3s + 12).\]This simplifies to
 \[r^2 - 2rs + s^2 + 7r - 7s - 8 = 0.\]Then $(r - s)^2 + 7(r - s) - 8 = 0,$ which factors as \[(r - s - 1)(r - s + 8) = 0.\]Thus, $r - s = 1$ or $r - s = -8.$ If $r - s = 1,$ then $s = r - 1,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r + 16.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r - 1) + (r + 16) = 0,$ which leads to $r = -5.$  Then $s = -6$ and $t = 11,$ and $b = -rst = -330.$
 If $r - s = -8,$ then $s = r + 8,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r - 11.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r + 8) + (r - 11) = 0,$ which leads to $r = 1.$  Then $s = 9$ and $t = -10,$ and $b = -rst = 90.$
 Thus, the possible values of $b$ are $\boxed{-330,90}.$
 *)



definition p :: "real ⇒ real" where
"p x ≡ x^3 + a*x + b"

definition q :: "real ⇒ real" where
"q x ≡ x^3 + a*x + b + 240"

theorem roots:
fixes r s a b :: real
assumes h0 : "p r = 0"
and h1 : "p s = 0"
and h2 : "q (r+4) = 0"
and h3 : "q (s-3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 ∨ b = 90"

end

 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_5.informal problem: Consider two cubic functions, $p(x) = x^3 + ax + b$ and $q(x) = x^3 + ax + b + 240$. If $r$ and $s$ are roots of $p(x)$, and $r+4$ and $s-3$ are roots of $q(x)$, determine the possible values of $b$. The final answer is $b = -330$ or $b = 90$.

a_6.formal problem:
theorem
fixes r s a b :: real and p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. p x = x powr 3 + a * x + b"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. q x = x powr 3 + a * x + b + 240"
and h2 : "poly (pcoeffs [b, a, 0, 1]) r = 0"
and h3 : "poly (pcoeffs [b, a, 0, 1]) s = 0"
and h4 : "poly (pcoeffs [b + 240, a, 0, 1]) (r + 4) = 0"
and h5 : "poly (pcoeffs [b + 240, a, 0, 1]) (s - 3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
a_6.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Real numbers $r$ and $s$ are roots of $p(x)=x^3+ax+b$, and $r+4$ and $s-3$ are roots of $q(x)=x^3+ax+b+240$. Enter all possible values of $b,$ separated by commas. The final Answer is -330,90
 ### Proof
 By Vieta's formulas, the sum of the roots of $p(x)$ is 0, so the third root is $t = -r - s.$  Also, \[a = rs + rt + st.\]The sum of the roots of $q(x)$ is also 0, so the third root is $-(r + 4) - (s - 3) = -r - s - 1 = t - 1.$  Also, \[a = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[rs + rt + st = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]This simplifies to $t = 4r - 3s + 13.$
 Also, $b = -rst$ and \[b + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[-rst + 240 = (r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Substituting $t = 4r - 3s + 13,$ we get \[-rs(4r - 3s + 13) + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(4r - 3s + 12).\]This simplifies to
 \[r^2 - 2rs + s^2 + 7r - 7s - 8 = 0.\]Then $(r - s)^2 + 7(r - s) - 8 = 0,$ which factors as \[(r - s - 1)(r - s + 8) = 0.\]Thus, $r - s = 1$ or $r - s = -8.$ If $r - s = 1,$ then $s = r - 1,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r + 16.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r - 1) + (r + 16) = 0,$ which leads to $r = -5.$  Then $s = -6$ and $t = 11,$ and $b = -rst = -330.$
 If $r - s = -8,$ then $s = r + 8,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r - 11.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r + 8) + (r - 11) = 0,$ which leads to $r = 1.$  Then $s = 9$ and $t = -10,$ and $b = -rst = 90.$
 Thus, the possible values of $b$ are $\boxed{-330,90}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes r s a b :: real and p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. p x = x powr 3 + a * x + b"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. q x = x powr 3 + a * x + b + 240"
and h2 : "poly (pcoeffs [b, a, 0, 1]) r = 0"
and h3 : "poly (pcoeffs [b, a, 0, 1]) s = 0"
and h4 : "poly (pcoeffs [b + 240, a, 0, 1]) (r + 4) = 0"
and h5 : "poly (pcoeffs [b + 240, a, 0, 1]) (s - 3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_6.informal problem: Given that there exist two polynomials $p(x) = x^3 + ax + b$ and $q(x) = x^3 + ax + b + 240$, and two real numbers $r$ and $s$ are roots of the polynomial $p$ such that $p(r) = p(s) = 0$. Furthermore, $r + 4$ is a root of the polynomial $q$ and $s - 3$ is also a root of $q$. Determine the possible values for $b$. The final answer is $b = -330$ or $b = 90$.

a_7.formal problem:
theorem
fixes r s a b :: real and p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. p x = x powr 3 + a * x + b"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. q x = x powr 3 + a * x + b + 240"
and h2 : "poly p r = 0"
and h3 : "poly p s = 0"
and h4 : "poly q (r + 4) = 0"
and h5 : "poly q (s - 3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
a_7.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Real numbers $r$ and $s$ are roots of $p(x)=x^3+ax+b$, and $r+4$ and $s-3$ are roots of $q(x)=x^3+ax+b+240$. Enter all possible values of $b,$ separated by commas. The final Answer is -330,90
 ### Proof
 By Vieta's formulas, the sum of the roots of $p(x)$ is 0, so the third root is $t = -r - s.$  Also, \[a = rs + rt + st.\]The sum of the roots of $q(x)$ is also 0, so the third root is $-(r + 4) - (s - 3) = -r - s - 1 = t - 1.$  Also, \[a = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[rs + rt + st = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]This simplifies to $t = 4r - 3s + 13.$
 Also, $b = -rst$ and \[b + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[-rst + 240 = (r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Substituting $t = 4r - 3s + 13,$ we get \[-rs(4r - 3s + 13) + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(4r - 3s + 12).\]This simplifies to
 \[r^2 - 2rs + s^2 + 7r - 7s - 8 = 0.\]Then $(r - s)^2 + 7(r - s) - 8 = 0,$ which factors as \[(r - s - 1)(r - s + 8) = 0.\]Thus, $r - s = 1$ or $r - s = -8.$ If $r - s = 1,$ then $s = r - 1,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r + 16.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r - 1) + (r + 16) = 0,$ which leads to $r = -5.$  Then $s = -6$ and $t = 11,$ and $b = -rst = -330.$
 If $r - s = -8,$ then $s = r + 8,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r - 11.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r + 8) + (r - 11) = 0,$ which leads to $r = 1.$  Then $s = 9$ and $t = -10,$ and $b = -rst = 90.$
 Thus, the possible values of $b$ are $\boxed{-330,90}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes r s a b :: real and p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. p x = x powr 3 + a * x + b"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. q x = x powr 3 + a * x + b + 240"
and h2 : "poly p r = 0"
and h3 : "poly p s = 0"
and h4 : "poly q (r + 4) = 0"
and h5 : "poly q (s - 3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_7.informal problem: Given two cubic functions $p(x) = x^3 + ax + b$ and $q(x) = x^3 + ax + b + 240$, where $a$ and $b$ are real numbers, find the possible values of $b$ if $r$ and $s$ are roots of $p(x)$, and $r + 4$ and $s - 3$ are roots of $q(x)$. The possible values for $b$ are $-330$ and $90$.

a_8.formal problem:
theorem
fixes r s a b :: real
assumes h0 : "poly [1, a, b] r = 0"
and h1 : "poly [1, a, b] s = 0"
and h2 : "poly [1, a, b + 240] (r + 4) = 0"
and h3 : "poly [1, a, b + 240] (s - 3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
a_8.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Real numbers $r$ and $s$ are roots of $p(x)=x^3+ax+b$, and $r+4$ and $s-3$ are roots of $q(x)=x^3+ax+b+240$. Enter all possible values of $b,$ separated by commas. The final Answer is -330,90
 ### Proof
 By Vieta's formulas, the sum of the roots of $p(x)$ is 0, so the third root is $t = -r - s.$  Also, \[a = rs + rt + st.\]The sum of the roots of $q(x)$ is also 0, so the third root is $-(r + 4) - (s - 3) = -r - s - 1 = t - 1.$  Also, \[a = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[rs + rt + st = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]This simplifies to $t = 4r - 3s + 13.$
 Also, $b = -rst$ and \[b + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[-rst + 240 = (r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Substituting $t = 4r - 3s + 13,$ we get \[-rs(4r - 3s + 13) + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(4r - 3s + 12).\]This simplifies to
 \[r^2 - 2rs + s^2 + 7r - 7s - 8 = 0.\]Then $(r - s)^2 + 7(r - s) - 8 = 0,$ which factors as \[(r - s - 1)(r - s + 8) = 0.\]Thus, $r - s = 1$ or $r - s = -8.$ If $r - s = 1,$ then $s = r - 1,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r + 16.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r - 1) + (r + 16) = 0,$ which leads to $r = -5.$  Then $s = -6$ and $t = 11,$ and $b = -rst = -330.$
 If $r - s = -8,$ then $s = r + 8,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r - 11.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r + 8) + (r - 11) = 0,$ which leads to $r = 1.$  Then $s = 9$ and $t = -10,$ and $b = -rst = 90.$
 Thus, the possible values of $b$ are $\boxed{-330,90}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes r s a b :: real
assumes h0 : "poly [1, a, b] r = 0"
and h1 : "poly [1, a, b] s = 0"
and h2 : "poly [1, a, b + 240] (r + 4) = 0"
and h3 : "poly [1, a, b + 240] (s - 3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_8.informal problem: Given two roots $r$ and $s$ of the quadratic polynomial $x^2+ax+b=0$, if $r+4$ is a root of the polynomial $x^2+ax+(b+240)=0$ and $s-3$ is also a root of the polynomial $x^2+ax+(b+240)=0$, what is the value of $b$? The possible solutions are $b=-330$ or $b=90$.

a_9.formal problem:
theorem
fixes r s a b :: real and p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. p x = x powr 3 + a * x + b"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. q x = x powr 3 + a * x + b + 240"
and h2 : "poly p r = 0"
and h3 : "poly p s = 0"
and h4 : "poly q (r + 4) = 0"
and h5 : "poly q (s - 3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
a_9.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Real numbers $r$ and $s$ are roots of $p(x)=x^3+ax+b$, and $r+4$ and $s-3$ are roots of $q(x)=x^3+ax+b+240$. Enter all possible values of $b,$ separated by commas. The final Answer is -330,90
 ### Proof
 By Vieta's formulas, the sum of the roots of $p(x)$ is 0, so the third root is $t = -r - s.$  Also, \[a = rs + rt + st.\]The sum of the roots of $q(x)$ is also 0, so the third root is $-(r + 4) - (s - 3) = -r - s - 1 = t - 1.$  Also, \[a = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[rs + rt + st = (r + 4)(s - 3) + (r + 4)(t - 1) + (s - 3)(t - 1).\]This simplifies to $t = 4r - 3s + 13.$
 Also, $b = -rst$ and \[b + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Hence, \[-rst + 240 = (r + 4)(s - 3)(t - 1).\]Substituting $t = 4r - 3s + 13,$ we get \[-rs(4r - 3s + 13) + 240 = -(r + 4)(s - 3)(4r - 3s + 12).\]This simplifies to
 \[r^2 - 2rs + s^2 + 7r - 7s - 8 = 0.\]Then $(r - s)^2 + 7(r - s) - 8 = 0,$ which factors as \[(r - s - 1)(r - s + 8) = 0.\]Thus, $r - s = 1$ or $r - s = -8.$ If $r - s = 1,$ then $s = r - 1,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r + 16.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r - 1) + (r + 16) = 0,$ which leads to $r = -5.$  Then $s = -6$ and $t = 11,$ and $b = -rst = -330.$
 If $r - s = -8,$ then $s = r + 8,$ and \[t = 4t - 3s + 13 = r - 11.\]But $r + s + t = 0,$ so $r + (r + 8) + (r - 11) = 0,$ which leads to $r = 1.$  Then $s = 9$ and $t = -10,$ and $b = -rst = 90.$
 Thus, the possible values of $b$ are $\boxed{-330,90}.$
 *)

theorem
fixes r s a b :: real and p q :: "real \<Rightarrow> real"
assumes h0 : "\<forall> x. p x = x powr 3 + a * x + b"
and h1 : "\<forall> x. q x = x powr 3 + a * x + b + 240"
and h2 : "poly p r = 0"
and h3 : "poly p s = 0"
and h4 : "poly q (r + 4) = 0"
and h5 : "poly q (s - 3) = 0"
shows  "b = -330 \<or> b = 90"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_9.informal problem: Consider two cubic polynomials $p(x) = x^3 + ax + b$ and $q(x) = x^3 + ax + b + 240$. Given that $p(r) = p(s) = 0$ and $q(r + 4) = q(s - 3) = 0$, find the possible values for $b$. The final answer is $b = -330$ or $b = 90$.
